subject: JUNIT and Databases
msgSnippet: Hi, Can someone tell me the best way to test a jdbc class using junit. Currently in my test i insert a record using setup() and then delete it after the test

Hi,

Can someone tell me the best way to test a jdbc class using junit.
Currently in my test i insert a record using setup() and then delete it after the test by using  teardown().

Of course if i dont have a delete method in my jdbc class this will not work, and the unit test will keep adding a record to the database.

Is there a better way to do this? 

Thanks in advance.
